{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3730650,"name":"Pranav Vanparty","username":"Pranav_v","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/7c8e57/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-04T02:37:03.121Z","cooked":"

Hey everyone,

I’ve been looking into PathPlanner’s pathfinding with AD* and wanted to dig deeper into the dynamic obstacle feature. I’ve read through the Java docs, so I understand how the method works, but I’m still trying to wrap my head around how to practically implement it.

Specifically:

  1. Detecting dynamic obstacles – How are teams usually detecting these in real-time? My first thought was object detection, but I’m not sure how we’d reliably get the depth (z) measurement away from the robot. I’ve thought of a stereo camera setup but I’m not sure how accurate that is

  2. Representing obstacle size – PathPlanner wants two points for the obstacle bounds. How do you all go about estimating another robot’s footprint in order to represent it accurately? Do you just pad a known FRC frame perimeter size, or is there a better way?
